intro: Echinopepon parviflorus, commonly known as the small-flowered prickly gourd, is a member of the Cucurbitaceae family. It is characterized by its spiny stems and leaves, which are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its fruit is a round, spiky gourd that can grow up to 10 centimeters in diameter. This plant is native to tropical regions of South America and is often cultivated for its ornamental value and edible fruit.
